item.title: Bitcoin miner Bitdeer dumps entire BTC reserves, holdings drop to zero
item.description: Bitcoin miner Bitdeer liquidated 943 BTC from reserves and sold newly mined coins, cutting corporate holdings to zero.

item.title: Crypto investors' interest moves ‚Äòpretty wide‚Äô beyond majors as dip drags: Exec
item.description: Robinhood‚Äôs head of crypto, Johann Kerbrat, pointed out that crypto investors are looking for more ways to explore crypto beyond just holding tokens amid market uncertainty.

item.title: Mentioning 'bitcoin' or crypto on AI agent OpenClaw's Discord will get you banned
item.description: The project's creator nearly deleted the viral AI agent after crypto scammers hijacked his accounts, launched a fake token that hit $16 million, and harassed him for weeks.

item.title: 50% of Bitcoin's past 24 months ended in gains: Economist
item.description: Economist Timothy Peterson expects Bitcoin to trade above its current level by December, though some analysts are pushing back on that view.

item.title: Trump raises global tariff rate to 15%, but crypto markets are unfazed
item.description: US President Donald Trump is now using alternative legal routes to levy tariffs, but critics say his authority to impose them is still limited.

item.title: Crypto market retraces almost all 2024-2025 US election pump gains
item.description: The crypto market experienced a historic market crash in October that derailed the uptrend and caused investor sentiment to plummet.

item.title: 'Ethereum Is Going Hard': Vitalik Buterin Backs Censorship Resistance Upgrade
item.description: Ethereum developers scheduled a controversial upgrade for later this year. Buterin said it reinforces the network‚Äôs cypherpunk principles.

item.description: Google Trends data shows the term hit a record high in the U.S. this month, though global interest has fallen since peaking in August.

item.description: The system would use zero-knowledge proofs and secure environments (MPC/TEEs) to protect voter identity and sensitive data while preventing coercion and bribery.

item.title: US lawmakers critical of Trump tariffs, say it will derail economy
item.description: The tariffs are just taxes on American businesses and consumers, while providing no benefit to the economy, critics of Trump's policies say.

item.title: Japan's SBI to issue 10 billion yen onchain bond with XRP rewards for retail investors
item.description: The SBI START Bonds offer a fixed interest rate, blockchain settlement, and XRP rewards for eligible investors registered on the firm‚Äôs exchange.

item.description: With the rial plunging, middle-class savers are bypassing local banks to move billions into the domestic crypto ecosystem.

item.description: The current levels offer an attractive entry for long-term investors, even if their patience will be tested, Vetle Lunde said.

item.title: Bitcoin's bull catalyst could be AI stocks turning 'silly big': Lyn Alden
item.description: Bitcoin only needs a ‚Äúmarginal amount of new demand‚Äù to push higher, according to macroeconomist Lyn Alden, who is watching for a potential peak in AI stocks as a signal.

item.title: SEC makes quiet shift to brokers' stablecoin holdings that may pack big results
item.description: The securities regulator has continued its Project Crypto work to make unofficial policy changes as it moved to let broker-dealers treat stablecoins as capital.

item.title: Tokenized real estate projects advance in Dubai and Maldives
item.description: A Trump-tied hotel development in the Maldives and the Dubai Land Department announced details on tokenizing their real estate projects this week.

item.title: Bitcoin shrugs off Trump's new tariffs, nears $68,000 as altcoins lead modest bounce
item.description: Crypto prices edged higher on Friday despite a splash of tariff turbulence after the U.S. Supreme Court ruled Trump's levies illegal.

item.title: Bitcoin whales participate in V-shaped accumulation, offsetting 230K BTC sell-off
item.description: Despite the sharp multi-month market downtrend, Bitcoin whales added 236,000 BTC since December 2025, with order size data showing large players building new positions.

item.title: Bitcoin Sell Pressure Is Easing, But Whales Keep Dumping on Exchanges: CryptoQuant
item.description: Bitcoin is down 46% from its October peak‚Äîand the largest holders keep depositing to exchanges, presumably to sell, says CryptoQuant.

item.description: Eric Trump called the offering a balance against meme coins, as the tokenization project has a lengthy timeline.

item.title: Bitcoin bears at risk of $600M liquidation, raising chance for rally to $70K
item.description: Despite bearish pressure and weak US economic data, Bitcoin's recovering hashrate and new onchain security protocols raise the chance for a surge to $70,000.

item.title: Dutch authorities call on Polymarket arm to cease activities
item.description: The prediction market's Dutch arm, Adventure One, allegedly offered illegal bets, including on elections in the Netherlands.

item.title: Crypto slides, but tokenized RWAs and VC push ahead
item.description: As Bitcoin and altcoins continue to sell off, venture capital is raising millions for blockchain-based financial infrastructure, while real-world assets continue to draw capital.

item.title: Trump announces 10% global tariff following SCOTUS ruling
item.description: The United States Supreme Court ruled on Friday that President Donald Trump could not use national emergency powers to levy tariffs during peacetime.

item.description: New research claims specialized AI dramatically outperforms general-purpose models at detecting exploited DeFi vulnerabilities.

item.description: The more significant result from the U.S. Supreme Court's rejection of President Donald Trump's trade tariffs may be political, which could sting the industry.

item.description: States are scoring victories against prediction markets when they invoke congressional intent, said a legal expert‚Äîand losing when they focus on narrower legal definitions.

item.title: Bitcoin Rises After Supreme Court Rules Against Trump Tariffs
item.description: Bitcoin ticked up after the Supreme Court ruled that President Trump exceeded his authority in imposing most tariffs on foreign goods.

item.description: Dubai Land Department and Ctrl Alt move to the next phase of real estate tokenization project, enabling the resale of property tokens.

item.description: The cinema chain has stepped back from screening an award-winning AI short while Hollywood battles over the technology‚Äôs creative role.

item.description: Lawmakers in South Korea are intensifying scrutiny over the role of regulators after Bithumb accidentally gave out $43 billion in Bitcoin.

item.description: Lawmakers warned that approving World Liberty Financial's bank charter application could jeopardize the legitimacy of the U.S. banking system.
